column10: Attending religious services for longer life
column11: Learn more about if your beliefs align with a particular religion and how regularly attending services could be good for your health.
column12: A study has shown that attending religious services and having that support structure has many benefits, including helping them to live longer as well as lowering blood pressure and cardiovascular disease. Read this article to hear more about the research.

column10: Helping you get the most out of the internet
column11: The internet can be an intimidating place, read this guide to help you make the most use out of using the internet.
column12: You might be surprised at how much you're able to do on the internet. You can connect with friends and family, take care of shopping, banking, as well as access services such as your GP surgery.  The internet can also be a great source of entertainment and education if you know how.

column10: Get internet savvy
column11: Sign up to take an internet tutorial to help you get started and make the most out of the internet.

column11: Learn about how to stay safe on the internet, to get the most out of your internet usage.
column12: The internet can make life a lot easier, but it doesn't come without the risk of online scams and frauds. Learn to protect yourself from scams and frauds, by learning what to look out for, and what to do if you suspect a scam.

column10: Learn more about video lectures

column10: Importance of flossing
column11: Although flossing is one of those annoying daily routines, learn more about the importance and benefits of flossing daily.
column12: Flossing regularly plays a crucial role in your dental hygiene. When you skip flossing, plaque can build up between your teeth and along the gumline. Over time, this can increase your risk of tooth decay and gum disease.

column10: Start building a habit of flossing your teeth daily
column11: Add flossing to your daily dental routine, build into your daily routine as a healthy habit and fight gum disease at the same time.

column10: Importance of dental check ups
column11: Learn about the importance of dental check-ups, and why you should have them regularly.
column12: Dental appointments shouldn’t just be made when you have a problem that needs to be addressed. Prevention is always better than needing a cure, and there are plenty more reasons why it’s important to maintain regular visits to your local dental practice.

column10: Book a dental check up
column11: Start booking your dental check-ups more regularly to build a healthy habit of keeping your teeth and gums in good condition, every six months is a reasonable goal.

column10: Importance of dental cleans
column11: Learn about the importance of visiting your dentist for a deep dental clean and why you should have them more regularly.
column12: Getting your teeth professionally cleaned every six months is very important, as this helps remove plaque and tartar build-up from the surfaces of teeth. This can help prevent tooth decay and gum disease, which could lead to other health problems if left untreated.

column10: Book a dental clean
column11: Start booking your dental cleans more regularly to build up a healthy habit of keeping your teeth and gums in good condition.

column10: Learn more about dental care
column11: From how long to brush your teeth for, to technique and products, learn more about the best way to take care of your teeth.
column12: Knowing how to brush your teeth properly is important to prevent conditions such as gingivitis and tooth decay. Incorrect brushing techniques could also lead to tooth abrasion, a condition in which the surface of the tooth is worn away.

column10: Improve your dental care
column11: Start practicing dental care techniques daily, make a habit of taking care of your teeth.

column10: A healthy sex life has many benefits for older adults
column11: Having sex is a really important part of overall health and happiness, and people that have it, tend to live longer, this article talks about the benefits of a healthy sex life for older adults.
column12: Some of the benefits you can get from sex include lowering blood pressure, burning calories, increasing heart health, strengthening muscles, reducing your risk of heart disease, stroke, and help with pain as well as easing stress.

column10: Improve your sex life
column11: Start working on improving your sex life to create a healthy habit and receive all the physical, mental and emotional benefits that come with it.

column10: Learn about the importance of getting enough sleep
column11: Just as eating nutritious food, drinking water, and exercising regularly is important, getting quality sleep is a crucial component for overall health.
column12: Sleep helps to restore the body and improves energy levels, waking up well-rested can have a positive impact on your mood, your mental health, reducing both anxiety and stress, sleep can also help with weight loss, strengthen heart and immune system.

column10: Work on making sure you get enough sleep
column11: Start working on getting into a sleeping routine to help improve your overall health and wellbeing.

column10: Learn about how listening to music can get you to sleep
column11: Struggling to sleep? Maybe listening to music can help you drift off to sleep, learn more about using music to help improve your sleep.
column12: Music is a powerful art form that can offer a simple way to improve sleep hygiene, improving your ability to fall asleep quickly, sleep deeply and awake feeling more rested.

column10: 8 hours of sleep music for a better night's sleep
column11: Listen to this playlist of calming relaxing music, to help you have a better night's sleep and create a better sleep habit.

column10: Learn how to increase the quality of your sleep
column11: Among the most common problems related to aging is sleep quality, with over half of adults reporting symptoms of insomnia. Learn how to better increase your sleep quality for a better night’s sleep.
column12: While duration is key, sleep quality is often overlooked. Even if you get your 8 hours of sleep, you may still wake up feeling lethargic and tired, relying on coffee, and wishing you could go back to sleep. If so, there's a good chance your sleep quality needs some work.

column10: Start increasing the quality of your sleep
column11: Start working on improving your sleep quality, build a healthy habit of good night's restful sleep.

column10: Understand the importance of working on your relationship
column11: Learn about the importance of working on, and improving your relationship with your partner, as well as tips to use to benefit those relationship.
column12: Social connections help to influence our long-term health in ways every bit as powerful as adequate sleep and a good diet. Studies have shown that people who have social support from family, friends, and their community are happier, have fewer health problems, and live longer.

column10: Learn the importance of listening to your body

column10: Importance of staying hydrated
column11: Drinking water does more than just quench your thirst. It's essential to keep your body functioning properly and feeling healthy, learn more about the importance of staying hydrated.
column12: Water is important in your body – from removing waste products in urine, to lubricating your joints, transporting nutrients around your body, and controlling your temperature. It can even help make your skin look good.

column11: Start tracking your intake daily to help create a healthy hydrated habit.

column10: Read more about the benefits of breathing exercises

column12: Breathing exercises not only improve your respiratory health, but they can also help build strength and stamina, as well as improve general mood and wellbeing.

column12: Carbon monoxide is an odourless and colourless gas that poses a severe health risk, as it’s highly toxic to humans. Having gas safety checks as well as a carbon monoxide detector can help keep you safe.

column10: Eating nuts can help you live longer
column11: Eating more nuts can help you live longer and have lower rates of heart disease, diabetes, and some types of cancer. Eating a handful of nuts a day can go a long way in benefitting your health.
column12: Eating nuts as part of a healthy diet may be good for the heart. Nuts contain unsaturated fatty acids and other nutrients. They are a great inexpensive snack food, easy to store and easy to pack when you're on the go.

column10: Get a healthy nutty subscription box
column11: With all the health benefits of eating nuts, add more nuts to your diet with a subscription service to get a delivery of nuts straight to your door.

column10: Try online hypnotherapy
column11: Try online hypnotherapy to help you to relive stress.
column12: Hypnotherapy, or clinical hypnosis, is a treatment where you're guided into a deeply relaxed state of highly focused awareness to affect change. In conjunction with other therapies, hypnosis has been found to be an effective treatment for chronic stress and related issues.

column11: Find a hypnotherapist for in person sessions, to help you gain all the benefits that hypnotherapy has to offer.
